title: US senators call SEC actions in Debt Box case ‘unconscionable’
description:
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission admitted to not being “accurate and candid” in its filings related to Debt Box, later petitioning the court to drop the case.

A group of five Republican lawmakers from the United States Senate have criticized the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) for its actions in a lawsuit against Digital Licensing, doing business as Debt Box.

In a Feb. 7 letter to SEC chair Gary Gensler, six Republican senators said they were “greatly concerned” by the commission’s conduct in the Debt Box case, claiming that the regulator operated in an “unethical and unprofessional manner.” In December, the SEC admitted in filings with the U.S. District Court for the District of Utah, Northern Division, that it had failed to be “accurate and candid” in its claims that Debt Box closed bank accounts and planned to relocate to the United Arab Emirates.

“Regardless of whether Commission staff deliberately misrepresented evidence or unknowingly presented false information, this case suggests other [emphasis added by authors] enforcement cases brought by the Commission may be deserving of scrutiny,” said the senators. “It is difficult to maintain confidence that other cases are not predicated upon dubious evidence, obfuscations, or outright misrepresentations.”

Read more

title: Bitcoin futures data hints at BTC price rally extending beyond $45K
description:
Bitcoin price finally pushed through the $45,000 resistance zone and futures data suggests that bulls will press BTC higher.

Bitcoin (BTC) surpassed $45,000 on Feb. 8, reaching the price level for the first time since Jan. 12 after rallying 6% in two days. This movement coincided with the S&P 500 reaching a record high on Feb. 7, indicating that investors sought protection from inflation. In addition to crypto and stocks rallying to new highs, Bitcoin derivatives data show there’s room for further bullish momentum.

The U.S. government debt currently stands at a historical high of $34.2 trillion. Some analysts and economists argue that the absolute number matters less than the interest paid, but U.S. Federal Reserve (Fed) Chairman Jerome Powell admitted to the long-term "unsustainable fiscal path" in a Feb. 4 interview.

This situation provides a strong incentive for the U.S. Fed to cut interest rates from the current 5.25% throughout 2024, which is their base case and aligned with market expectations. When returns on fixed-income investments are reduced, investors tend to seek refuge in stocks and commodities.

Read more

title: What is ERC-404?
description: Non-fungible tokens (NFTs) have exploded in popularity for their ability to represent unique digital assets.

title: Vaneck Exec States Solana Outage Might Have Been Manually Triggered
description: Matthew Sigel, head of digital assets research at Vaneck, revealed that there is speculation around the cause of the latest Solana outage, which stopped its blockchain by five hours. Sigel explained that the bug that created this service interruption was related to the Berkley Packet Filter (BPF) and that it might have been manually triggered. […]

title: Solana TVL’s 20-month peak hits $1.8 billion; more price gains ahead?
description: SOL price broke above the $100 milestone on Feb. 8; recent growth trends in Solana Total Value Locked (TVL) suggest more gains could follow.
